intro: Astephanus triflorus, commonly known as the three-flowered stephanus, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters of three, giving it its common name. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a distinctive aromatic scent. Astephanus triflorus is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
